situation: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The camel has 5 dollars. The coyote is named Casper. The leopard has 14 dollars. The ostrich dreamed of a luxury aircraft. The reindeer has 76 dollars, and was born three and a half years ago. The reindeer has a basketball with a diameter of 29 inches, and is a teacher assistant. The seal swims in the pool next to the house of the ostrich. The swan swears to the ostrich. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: The ostrich will swear to the dalmatian if it (the ostrich) owns a luxury aircraft. Rule2: If the swan swears to the ostrich and the seal swims inside the pool located besides the house of the ostrich, then the ostrich will not swear to the dalmatian. Rule3: Here is an important piece of information about the ostrich: if it has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the coyote's name then it swears to the dalmatian for sure. Rule4: Here is an important piece of information about the reindeer: if it is more than 8 months old then it does not smile at the gorilla for sure. Rule5: The dalmatian hides her cards from the seahorse whenever at least one animal smiles at the gorilla. Rule6: Here is an important piece of information about the reindeer: if it has more money than the leopard and the camel combined then it smiles at the gorilla for sure. Rule7: The reindeer will smile at the gorilla if it (the reindeer) has a basketball that fits in a 19.3 x 31.7 x 32.1 inches box. Rule1 is preferred over Rule2. Rule3 is preferred over Rule2. Rule6 is preferred over Rule4. Rule7 is preferred over Rule4.
question: Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the dalmatian hide the cards that she has from the seahorse?
label: proved
